results.title: Australian diary. No. 093
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: the paddle-steamer Coonawarra on the Murray River provides visitors with an opportunity to see the scenic wonder of the river; a N.S.W. family are skilled in hobbies and handicrafts making shell necklaces, souvenirs and dolls; huge tractors are built in Australian factory in Rydelmere, N.S.W. and these large earthmoving pieces of equipment are capable of carrying 20 tons at a speed of 30 m.p.h..
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan

results.title: Australian diary. No. 092
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: Melbourne’s Royal Women’s Hospital provides mothers-to-be with all the facilities necessary for pre-natal and post-natal care; Newcastle’s State Dockyard is capable of building ships equal to the world’s best; Gundagai comes to life as the country town parades its pastoral wealth.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 091
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The aeroplane is playing an important part in the Australian economy by transporting perishable goods and general supplies across the vast distances of the continent; grasshoppers are fighting a losing battle against the modern insecticide and the aeroplane; swamplands surrounding Pedbank Weir are attracting migratory birds in their thousands.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan

results.title: Australian diary. No. 090
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: Trainee air hostesses receive instruction in such subjects as care of children handling of emergency equipment; the arts of make-up and hairstyling; training of dogs to help police in the enforcement of law and order; how “Meals on Wheels”, a scheme founded and organized by Miss Doris Taylor, who was crippled, renders life easier for the aged and infirm.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan

results.title: Australian diary. No. 089
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: To painters and riggers working on Sydney’s Harbour Bridge walking on narrow girders high above the city is no different to walking down a suburban street; Bell Bay, Tasmania, is the site of the first complete aluminium smelter in the Southern hemisphere; Sydney’s Garrison Church provides a link with early pioneers; Australian Boy Scouts take part in the Eighth World Jamboree held at Niagara, Canada.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan

results.title: Australian diary. No. 088
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: A team of women golfers from Britain show their skill on Sydney’s Kensington Links; Trade Unions celebrate the centenary of the movement for shorter working hours - 8 hours work, 8 hours recreation, 8 hours rest; the Valley of Burragorang is deemed to die in the interests of progress - a vast inland sea providing water for Sydney will take possession of the land.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan

results.title: Australian diary. No. 087
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: at the Sydney Conservatorium of Music, a ballet, staged and created by a group of teenagers is performed and received enthusiastic praise from audiences; the making of whisky is shown requiring the skill of experts; hoops are used to provide children with a novel method of physical exercise.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 086
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a vital service is carried out by the Water Police in New South Wales; Grandpa’s pride and joy automobile is still full of pep; Darwin, gateway to the north of this vast continent, gets a new look.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 085
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following stories are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: for miles along the New South Wales coast oyster growers practice intense cultivation - studying the oysters food requirmentd and encouraging it to breed; members of Sydney’s Miniature Locomotive Society run trains for children and at the same time raise money for charity; Montagu Swamp in North-West Tasmania is cleared to provide land for agriculture.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 084
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: at Camden Park Dairy, the installation of a Rotolacter has resulted in milking becoming an all mchanical process, setting new standards in hygiene; a Tasmanian factory shows how specialized artists create new effects and manufacture textiles in perfect colour register; to increase friendshp and understanding between neighbours, Malaya and Australia are exchanging Air Cadets.
